questions.question:
What will be the output of running the following command?

docker ps -a
questions.explanation: 'docker ps -a' lists all containers, both running and stopped.

questions.question:
What will be the output of running the following command?

docker --version

What will be the output of the following command?

docker images
questions.explanation: 'docker images' lists all Docker images stored locally.

questions.question:
What will be the output of running the following command?

docker rm $(docker ps -a -q)
questions.explanation: 'docker rm $(docker ps -a -q)' removes all stopped containers.

questions.question:
What will be the output of the following command?

docker run hello-world
questions.explanation: 'docker run hello-world' runs the hello-world container and outputs a welcome message if successful.

questions.question:
What will be the output of running the following command?

docker build -t myapp .
questions.explanation: 'docker build -t myapp .' builds a Docker image with the tag 'myapp' from the Dockerfile in the current directory.

questions.question:
What will be the output of running the following command?

docker pull ubuntu
questions.explanation: 'docker pull ubuntu' downloads the latest Ubuntu image from Docker Hub.

questions.question:
What will be the output of running the following command?

docker stop $(docker ps -q)
questions.explanation: 'docker stop $(docker ps -q)' stops all currently running containers.

questions.question:
What will be the output of running the following command?

docker rmi $(docker images -q)
questions.explanation: 'docker rmi $(docker images -q)' removes all images from the Docker environment.

questions.question:
What will be the output of running the following command?

docker logs container_id
options: Show the logs of a container
questions.explanation: 'docker logs container_id' shows the log output of the specified container.
